title: How to stop oversharing details of your sex life
text:
Next Story : Indulge in luxurious oils with Lakme Salon

Sometimes you may feel that it's okay to share every detail of your love life with your BFFs or with your siblings and cousins. But oversharing details can only be tantamount to breaching confidentiality. You may talk about your relationship with the people you are close to, but drawing a boundary between what you can share and what you can't can only help in making your relationship stronger. Sex life is one area where one needs to be circumspect - ideally, what happens in bedroom should remain in the bedroom. So, here's how you can stop oversharing details about your sex life.Be truthful. Tell your partner that you do talk to your close ones about your relationship. Let him express his feelings. If he expresses displeasure, make non-diclosure of any kind of information, sexual details or otherwise, a part of your relationship rulebook.In other words, put yourself in his shoes. Suppose you find out that your partner has been sharing intimate details of your sex life with his close friends, how will you feel? Won't you feel enraged and consider this breach of privacy? Think.You may be extremely close to your friend, but what if she has a habit of unwittingly blurting out secrets? What if she is a loving person, but has this one flaw of not being able to keep secrets close to her chest? Therefore, choose your confidante wisely.You need to practise silence. No matter how elated you feel because you have an exciting sex life, do not talk to people about your partner's sexual fetishes or your bedroom kinks. That should be a rule you need to abide by.
description: Your BFFs and members of your family do not need to know the intimate details of your sex life. Seriously. Here's how to stop yourself from oversharing.
